result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard T. Anderson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Can be discharged after 6 months if approved by Probation. If success completion of Probation defendant may petition the court to reopen/vacate and dismiss charge. Must report to probation today (8/20/15).

miscConds.notes: $265.60 fine/cost to be paid to Probation while on Probation.
Must complete a COMPAS Evaluation and follow through.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
